cards.name: Seal of Doom
cards.text: Sacrifice Seal of Doom: Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor:
"A basilisk's gaze is effective, but disposing of physical remains is a tiresome task. It's far more discrete to dissolve one's victim entirely."
—Szadek
cards.originalText: Sacrifice Seal of Doom: Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Slaughterhouse Bouncer
cards.text: Hellbent — When Slaughterhouse Bouncer dies, if you have no cards in hand, target creature gets -3/-3 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: A Rakdos party is a flop if anyone lives to talk about it.
cards.originalText: Hellbent When Slaughterhouse Bouncer is put into a graveyard from play, if you have no cards in hand, target creature gets -3/-3 until end of turn.

cards.name: Slithering Shade
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{B}: Slithering Shade gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
Hellbent — Slithering Shade can attack as though it didn't have defender as long as you have no cards in hand.

rulings.text: If you declare Slithering Shade as an attacker, then a card is put into your hand, the Shade won't be removed from combat. It continues to attack.

cards.originalText:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{B}: Slithering Shade gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
Hellbent Slithering Shade can attack as though it didn't have defender as long as you have no cards in hand.

cards.name: Unliving Psychopath
cards.text:
{B}: Unliving Psychopath gets +1/-1 until end of turn.
{B}, {T}: Destroy target creature with power less than Unliving Psychopath's power.
cards.flavor:
"The victim bears the marks of the 'Ktozok Impaler'. . . but he was executed years ago!"
—Gorev Hadszak, Wojek investigator

rulings.text: The creature must have less power than Unliving Psychopath both when the ability is activated and when it resolves.

cards.originalText:
{B}: Unliving Psychopath gets +1/-1 until end of turn.
{B}, {T}: Destroy target creature with power less than Unliving Psychopath's power.

cards.name: Vesper Ghoul
cards.text: {T}, Pay 1 life: Add one mana of any color.
cards.flavor:
"Nature's exceptions remind us not to think in absolutes. Just as the orchid blossoms on blackened stone, so does the gift of mana occasionally manifest in the undead."
—Bougrat, druid of the Cult of Yore
cards.originalText: {T}, Pay 1 life: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

cards.name: Wit's End
cards.text: Target player discards their hand.
cards.flavor:
"Some images are so powerful that one glance burns them into your mind forever. Come, let us gaze on nothingness."
—Szadek
cards.originalText: Target player discards his or her hand.

cards.name: Cackling Flames
cards.text:
Cackling Flames deals 3 damage to any target.
Hellbent — Cackling Flames deals 5 damage to that permanent or player instead if you have no cards in hand.
cards.flavor:
"I like a little entertainment with my dinner."
—Rakdos
cards.originalText:
Cackling Flames deals 3 damage to target creature or player.
Hellbent Cackling Flames deals 5 damage to that creature or player instead if you have no cards in hand.

cards.name: Demonfire
cards.text:
Demonfire deals X damage to any target. If a creature dealt damage this way would die this turn, exile it instead.
Hellbent — If you have no cards in hand, this spell can't be countered and the damage can't be prevented.
cards.originalText:
Demonfire deals X damage to target creature or player. If a creature dealt damage this way would be put into a graveyard this turn, remove it from the game instead.
Hellbent If you have no cards in hand, Demonfire can't be countered by spells or abilities and the damage can't be prevented.

cards.name: Flame-Kin War Scout
cards.text: When another creature enters the battlefield, sacrifice Flame-Kin War Scout. If you do, Flame-Kin War Scout deals 4 damage to that creature.
cards.flavor:
"The forward flame-kin are popping. We have incoming!"
—Svar, Boros signaler

rulings.text: If multiple creatures enter the battlefield at the same time, Flame-Kin War Scout's ability will trigger multiple times. When the first of these triggers resolves, if Flame Kin War Scout can be sacrificed by the ability's controller, it will be sacrificed and deal 4 damage. When the other triggers resolve, it won't be on the battlefield, so it can't be sacrificed and the other creatures won't be dealt any damage.

foreignNames.name: 炎の血族の戦場偵察兵

cards.originalText: When another creature comes into play, sacrifice Flame-Kin War Scout. If you do, Flame-Kin War Scout deals 4 damage to that creature.

cards.name: Flaring Flame-Kin
cards.text: As long as Flaring Flame-Kin is enchanted, it gets +2/+2, has trample, and has "{R}: Flaring Flame-Kin gets +1/+0 until end of turn."
cards.flavor: A flame-kin is always formidable, but feeding its fire with a sorcerous gift grants it the power to devastate armies.
cards.originalText: As long as Flaring Flame-Kin is enchanted, it gets +2/+2, has trample, and has "{R}: Flaring Flame-Kin gets +1/+0 until end of turn."

cards.name: Gnat Alley Creeper
cards.text: Gnat Alley Creeper can't be blocked by creatures with flying.
cards.flavor: Despite its diminutive name, Gnat Alley is the longest street in Ravnica. Mile after twisting mile, it threads its way among the broader, safer thoroughfares like a parasite.

rulings.text: Creatures with the Reach ability (such as Giant Spider) can block this because they don't actually have Flying.

foreignNames.name: Fureteur de la ruelle aux moucherons
羽虫小路の忍び寄る者

cards.originalText: Gnat Alley Creeper can't be blocked by creatures with flying.

cards.name: Ignorant Bliss
cards.text: Exile all cards from your hand face down. At the beginning of the next end step, return those cards to your hand, then draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"A quick step beyond oblivion lies a place so full of thoughts that it leaves no room for your own."
—Quyzl, chronarch prodigy

rulings.text: No player may look at the cards while they're face down.
If you cast this during the End step, you won't return the cards to your hand or draw a card until the next turn's End step.
If the delayed triggered ability is countered (for example, with Voidslime), the cards remain exiled forever.

cards.originalText: Remove all cards in your hand from the game face down. At end of turn, return those cards to your hand, then draw a card.

cards.name: Kill-Suit Cultist
cards.text:
Kill-Suit Cultist attacks each combat if able.
{B}, Sacrifice Kill-Suit Cultist: The next time damage would be dealt to target creature this turn, destroy that creature instead.
cards.flavor: Dressed to kill.

rulings.text: This ability causes a creature to be destroyed instead of being dealt damage. Damage replaced this way isn't dealt, and effects that would happen based on this damage (such as Demonfire's "exile it" effect) don't happen.

cards.originalText:
Kill-Suit Cultist attacks each turn if able.
{B}, Sacrifice Kill-Suit Cultist: The next time damage would be dealt to target creature this turn, destroy that creature instead.

cards.name: Kindle the Carnage
cards.text: Discard a card at random. If you do, Kindle the Carnage deals damage equal to that card's converted mana cost to each creature. You may repeat this process any number of times.
cards.flavor: "Start knockin' heads, boys, and don't stop 'til the ragamuffyn sings!"

rulings.text: You decide whether to repeat the process after each iteration. In other words, you discard a card, see what it is, Kindle the Carnage deals damage, then you decide whether to continue. If so, you discard a card, see what it is, Kindle the Carnage deals damage, then you decide whether to continue, and so on.
Any damage prevention or regeneration abilities must be activated before Kindle the Carnage starts resolving in order to have any effect. You can't wait to see which (if any) cards are discarded.

A creature that's been dealt lethal damage by an iteration of this effect will remain on the battlefield and be dealt more damage by any further iterations. After you stop, all creatures that have been dealt lethal damage are put into their owners' graveyards at the same time.

All the damage has the same source. However, each iteration of this process is a separate instance of damage. An effect that prevents damage the "next time" this card would deal it will prevent damage from only one iteration.
A single regeneration shield is sufficient to save a particular creature, no matter how many instances of damage are on it.

cards.originalText: Discard a card at random. If you do, Kindle the Carnage deals damage equal to that card's converted mana cost to each creature. You may repeat this process any number of times.

cards.name: Ogre Gatecrasher
cards.text: When Ogre Gatecrasher enters the battlefield, destroy target creature with defender.
cards.flavor: A popular game among ogres is to see how many revolutions a head can make before it pops off.
cards.originalText: When Ogre Gatecrasher comes into play, destroy target creature with defender.

cards.name: Psychotic Fury
cards.text:
Target multicolored creature gains double strike until end of turn.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"Rage, my servants. Our ancient power is renewed in blood."
—Rakdos
cards.originalText:
Target multicolored creature gains double strike until end of turn.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Rakdos Pit Dragon
cards.text:
{R}{R}: Rakdos Pit Dragon gains flying until end of turn.
{R}: Rakdos Pit Dragon gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
Hellbent — Rakdos Pit Dragon has double strike as long as you have no cards in hand.

rulings.text: If Rakdos Pit Dragon loses double strike after first strike combat damage has been dealt, it won't deal damage during the normal combat damage step.

foreignNames.name: ラクドスの地獄ドラゴン

cards.originalText:
{R}{R}: Rakdos Pit Dragon gains flying until end of turn.
{R}: Rakdos Pit Dragon gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
Hellbent Rakdos Pit Dragon has double strike as long as you have no cards in hand.

cards.name: Sandstorm Eidolon
cards.text:
{R}, Sacrifice Sandstorm Eidolon: Target creature can't block this turn.
Whenever you cast a multicolored spell, you may return Sandstorm Eidolon from your graveyard to your hand.

foreignNames.name: Eidôlon de la tempête de sable

cards.originalText:
{R}, Sacrifice Sandstorm Eidolon: Target creature can't block this turn.
Whenever you play a multicolored spell, you may return Sandstorm Eidolon from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Seal of Fire
cards.text: Sacrifice Seal of Fire: It deals 2 damage to any target.
cards.flavor:
"If it breathes, it will burn."
—Rakdos pyromancers' creed
cards.originalText: Sacrifice Seal of Fire: Seal of Fire deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Squealing Devil
cards.text:
Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
When Squealing Devil enters the battlefield, you may pay {X}. If you do, target creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn.
When Squealing Devil enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless {B} was spent to cast it.

rulings.text: For this creature to not be sacrificed, {B} must have been spent on the {1}{R} mana cost. It doesn't matter if {B} is spent on {X}.
You choose the value of X as Squealing Devil's ability resolves. X can be 0.
If this enters the battlefield in a way other than announcing it as a spell, then the appropriate mana can't have been paid, and you'll have to sacrifice it.

cards.originalText:
Fear
When Squealing Devil comes into play, you may pay {X}. If you do, target creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn.
When Squealing Devil comes into play, sacrifice it unless {B} was spent to play it.

cards.name: Stalking Vengeance
cards.text:
Haste
Whenever another creature you control dies, it deals damage equal to its power to target player or planeswalker.
cards.flavor: Something roams the killing places, sniffing the guilt of the slayers, stalking them on iron paws.
cards.originalText:
Haste
Whenever another creature you control is put into a graveyard from play, it deals damage equal to its power to target player.

cards.name: Stormscale Anarch
cards.text: {2}{R}, Discard a card at random: Stormscale Anarch deals 2 damage to any target. If the discarded card was multicolored, Stormscale Anarch deals 4 damage to that permanent or player instead.

rulings.text: You can't discard a card at random, see what it is, and then decide whether or not to pay the mana. Mana abilities must be activated before costs are paid. At the time you pay the cost of discarding a card, you either have enough mana in your mana pool to pay the {2}{R}, in which case you must continue no matter what you discarded, or you don't have enough mana in your mana pool to pay the {2}{R}, in which case you must back up no matter what you discarded.

cards.originalText: {2}{R}, Discard a card at random: Stormscale Anarch deals 2 damage to target creature or player. If the discarded card was multicolored, Stormscale Anarch deals 4 damage to that creature or player instead.

cards.name: Taste for Mayhem
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+0.
Hellbent — Enchanted creature gets an additional +2/+0 as long as you have no cards in hand.
cards.flavor: The taste of blood breaks down what little self-control the Rakdos possess.
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+0.
Hellbent Enchanted creature gets an additional +2/+0 as long as you have no cards in hand.

cards.name: Utvara Scalper
cards.text:
Flying
Utvara Scalper attacks each combat if able.
cards.flavor: He wages war wherever the wind carries him.
cards.originalText:
Flying
Utvara Scalper attacks each turn if able.

cards.name: War's Toll
cards.text:
Whenever an opponent taps a land for mana, tap all lands that player controls.
If a creature an opponent controls attacks, all creatures that opponent controls attack if able.
cards.flavor: Razia, archangel of war, demands total commitment.

rulings.text: Your opponent can tap lands for mana in response to the triggered ability. The effect won't prevent your opponent from casting spells or activating abilities, but it will make it difficult for that player to cast other spells or activate abilities later in the turn because players' mana pools empty at the end of each step.

cards.originalText:
Whenever an opponent taps a land for mana, tap all lands that player controls.
If a creature an opponent controls attacks, all creatures that opponent controls attack if able.

cards.name: Weight of Spires
cards.text: Weight of Spires deals damage to target creature equal to the number of nonbasic lands that creature's controller controls.
cards.flavor:
"Finally, a good use for an Azorius courthouse."
—Ghut Rak, Gruul guildmage
cards.originalText: Weight of Spires deals damage to target creature equal to the number of nonbasic lands that creature's controller controls.

cards.name: Whiptail Moloch
cards.text: When Whiptail Moloch enters the battlefield, it deals 3 damage to target creature you control.
cards.flavor:
"It wags its tail when it's happy. It wags its tail when it's angry. Nope, there's no good time to be around a whiptail."
—Rugar, Leaguehall Infirmary patient

foreignNames.name: Diable cornu à queue en fouet

cards.originalText: When Whiptail Moloch comes into play, it deals 3 damage to target creature you control.

cards.name: Aquastrand Spider
cards.text:
Graft 2 (This creature enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it. Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, you may move a +1/+1 counter from this creature onto it.)
{G}: Target creature with a +1/+1 counter on it gains reach until end of turn. (It can block creatures with flying.)
cards.originalText:
Graft 2 (This creature comes into play with two +1/+1 counters on it. Whenever another creature comes into play, you may move a +1/+1 counter from this creature onto it.)
{G}: Target creature with a +1/+1 counter on it can block as though it had flying this turn.

cards.name: Cytoplast Root-Kin
cards.text:
Graft 4 (This creature enters the battlefield with four +1/+1 counters on it. Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, you may move a +1/+1 counter from this creature onto it.)
When Cytoplast Root-Kin enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on each other creature you control with a +1/+1 counter on it.
{2}: Move a +1/+1 counter from target creature you control onto Cytoplast Root-Kin.
cards.originalText:
Graft 4 (This creature comes into play with four +1/+1 counters on it. Whenever another creature comes into play, you may move a +1/+1 counter from this creature onto it.)
When Cytoplast Root-Kin comes into play, put a +1/+1 counter on each other creature you control that has a +1/+1 counter on it.
{2}: Move a +1/+1 counter from target creature you control onto Cytoplast Root-Kin.

cards.name: Cytospawn Shambler
cards.text:
Graft 6 (This creature enters the battlefield with six +1/+1 counters on it. Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, you may move a +1/+1 counter from this creature onto it.)
{G}: Target creature with a +1/+1 counter on it gains trample until end of turn.

foreignNames.name: 細胞卵のシャンブラー

cards.originalText:
Graft 6 (This creature comes into play with six +1/+1 counters on it. Whenever another creature comes into play, you may move a +1/+1 counter from this creature onto it.)
{G}: Target creature with a +1/+1 counter on it gains trample until end of turn.

cards.name: Elemental Resonance
cards.text:
Enchant permanent
At the beginning of your precombat main phase, add mana equal to enchanted permanent's mana cost. (Mana cost includes color. If a mana symbol has multiple colors, choose one.)

rulings.text: If the enchanted permanent's mana cost is {2}{W}{U}, this Aura's controller adds {C}{C}{W}{U} to their mana pool. If its mana cost is {X}{G}, this Aura's controller adds {G} to their mana pool. If its mana cost is (W/U)(W/U), this Aura's controller chooses whether to add {W}{W}, {W}{U}, or {U}{U} to their mana pool. The choice may be different each time the ability resolves.
This ability isn't a mana ability. It uses the stack.
Only the first main phase in a turn is the "precombat main phase," even if additional main phases are generated by some effect.
You get the mana whether you want it or not. If you don't spend it, it will disappear at the end of the current step (or phase).

cards.originalText:
Enchant permanent
At the beginning of your precombat main phase, add mana equal to enchanted permanent's mana cost to your mana pool. (Mana cost includes color. If a mana symbol has multiple colors, choose one.)

cards.name: Fertile Imagination
cards.text: Choose a card type. Target opponent reveals their hand. Create two 1/1 green Saproling creature tokens for each card of the chosen type revealed this way. (Artifact, creature, enchantment, instant, land, planeswalker, sorcery, and tribal are card types.)
cards.originalText: Choose a card type. Target opponent reveals his or her hand. Put two 1/1 green Saproling creature tokens into play for each card of the chosen type revealed this way. (The card types are artifact, creature, enchantment, instant, land, and sorcery.)

cards.name: Flash Foliage
cards.text:
Cast this spell only during combat after blockers are declared.
Create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token that's blocking target creature attacking you.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"This undemanding vegetation takes root in a mote of dust but grows incredibly quickly."
—Simic research notes

rulings.text: The Saproling token is blocking the attacking creature, even if the block couldn't legally be declared (for example, if the attacking creature has flying, or is Vindictive Mob).
Putting a blocking creature onto the battlefield doesn't trigger "When this creature blocks" abilities. It also won't check blocking restrictions, costs, or requirements.

Putting a blocking creature onto the battlefield will trigger "When this creature becomes blocked by a creature" abilities. It may trigger "When this creature becomes blocked" abilities, but only if the creature the Saproling is blocking had not yet been blocked that combat.
The target creature can be blocked by other creatures.

Flash Foliage can be cast only during an opponent's combat phase, after attackers have been declared. If it's cast after combat damage is dealt, the Saproling will enter the battlefield blocking the attacking creature, but will neither deal combat damage to it nor be dealt combat damage by it.
With the latest Oracle update, you can only cast this during combat, after blockers have been declared.
If a turn has multiple combat phases, this spell can be cast during any of them as long as it's after the beginning of that phase's Declare Blockers Step.

cards.originalText:
Put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token into play blocking target creature attacking you.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Indrik Stomphowler
cards.text: When Indrik Stomphowler enters the battlefield, destroy target artifact or enchantment.
cards.flavor:
"An indrik's howl has destructive power much subtler than that of its crushing foot. The sound is mundane, but inaudible vibrations scatter and sunder magical contrivances."
—Simic research notes
cards.originalText: When Indrik Stomphowler comes into play, destroy target artifact or enchantment.

cards.name: Loaming Shaman
cards.text: When Loaming Shaman enters the battlefield, target player shuffles any number of target cards from their graveyard into their library.
cards.flavor: His work determines who is remembered and who feeds the worms.

rulings.text: Loaming Shaman's controller chooses all the targets when the ability is put on the stack.

cards.originalText: When Loaming Shaman comes into play, target player shuffles any number of target cards from his or her graveyard into his or her library.

cards.name: Might of the Nephilim
cards.text: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn for each of its colors.
cards.flavor:
"Send a runner to Tin Street, and tell 'em the delivery has been . . . uh . . . held up."
—Bonmod, caravan rear guard
cards.originalText: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn for each of its colors.

cards.name: Patagia Viper
cards.text:
Flying
When Patagia Viper enters the battlefield, create two 1/1 green and blue Snake creature tokens.
When Patagia Viper enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless {U} was spent to cast it.

rulings.text: If this enters the battlefield in a way other than announcing it as a spell, then the appropriate mana can't have been paid, and you'll have to sacrifice it.

cards.originalText:
Flying
When Patagia Viper comes into play, put two 1/1 green and blue Snake creature tokens into play.
When Patagia Viper comes into play, sacrifice it unless {U} was spent to play it.

cards.name: Protean Hulk
cards.text: When Protean Hulk dies, search your library for any number of creature cards with total converted mana cost 6 or less and put them onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor:
"Meat and eggs. We eat!"
—Borborygmos

rulings.text: If a card in your library has {X} in its mana cost, X is considered to be 0.

You can find any number of creature cards, so long as their total converted mana cost is 6 or less. For example, you could find eight creature cards with converted mana cost 0 and three with converted mana cost 2, but you couldn't find two with converted mana cost 4.

cards.originalText: When Protean Hulk is put into a graveyard from play, search your library for any number of creature cards with total converted mana cost 6 or less and put them into play. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Simic Basilisk
cards.text:
Graft 3 (This creature enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it. Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, you may move a +1/+1 counter from this creature onto it.)
{1}{G}: Until end of turn, target creature with a +1/+1 counter on it gains "Whenever this creature deals combat damage to a creature, destroy that creature at end of combat."

foreignNames.name: シミックのバジリスク

cards.originalText:
Graft 3 (This creature comes into play with three +1/+1 counters on it. Whenever another creature comes into play, you may move a +1/+1 counter from this creature onto it.)
{1}{G}: Until end of turn, target creature with a +1/+1 counter on it gains "Whenever this creature deals combat damage to a creature, destroy that creature at end of combat."

cards.name: Simic Initiate
cards.text: Graft 1 (This creature enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it. Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, you may move a +1/+1 counter from this creature onto it.)
cards.flavor: Simic initiates begin their training as experimental subjects. Failures are flushed to the undersewers.
cards.originalText: Graft 1 (This creature comes into play with a +1/+1 counter on it. Whenever another creature comes into play, you may move a +1/+1 counter from this creature onto it.)

cards.name: Simic Ragworm
cards.text: {U}: Untap Simic Ragworm.
cards.flavor:
"Infused with autochthon blood for size and hellion cells for speed, the ragworm is perfect for clearing the undergardens of both rats and vagrants."
—Yolov, Simic bioengineer
cards.originalText: {U}: Untap Simic Ragworm.

cards.name: Sporeback Troll
cards.text:
Graft 2 (This creature enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it. Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, you may move a +1/+1 counter from this creature onto it.)
{1}{G}: Regenerate target creature with a +1/+1 counter on it.
cards.originalText:
Graft 2 (This creature comes into play with two +1/+1 counters on it. Whenever another creature comes into play, you may move a +1/+1 counter from this creature onto it.)
{1}{G}: Regenerate target creature with a +1/+1 counter on it.

cards.name: Sprouting Phytohydra
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Whenever Sprouting Phytohydra is dealt damage, you may create a token that's a copy of Sprouting Phytohydra.
cards.flavor: A hydra tender's problem isn't having enough defenses but enough pots.

rulings.text: A token copy of Sprouting Phytohydra is created even if the damage dealt to Sprouting Phytohydra destroys it.
If a token copy of Sprouting Phytohydra is dealt damage, it will create another token copy.

If Cytoshape turns a creature into a copy of Sprouting Phytohydra, and that creature is dealt damage, the token that is put onto the battlefield is simply a copy of Sprouting Phytohydra. At the end of the turn, the Cytoshaped creature will revert back to what it was, but the token copying it will not.

cards.originalText:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Whenever Sprouting Phytohydra is dealt damage, you may put a token into play that's a copy of Sprouting Phytohydra.

cards.name: Stomp and Howl
cards.text: Destroy target artifact and target enchantment.
cards.flavor:
"Mizzium may be impervious to fire, but obviously certain other things can . . . modify its form."
—Ivos Koba, indrik handler

rulings.text: This spell can't be cast unless there are both an artifact and an enchantment on the battlefield to target. If a permanent is both an artifact and an enchantment, it can be both targets.

cards.originalText: Destroy target artifact and target enchantment.

cards.name: Street Savvy
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +0/+2 and can block creatures with landwalk abilities as though they didn't have those abilities.
cards.flavor: "It takes more than swift feet and dark shadows to slip by me unnoticed."

rulings.text: "Landwalk abilities" are abilities such as "forestwalk" or "legendary landwalk" that have "walk" in the name.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +0/+2 and can block creatures with landwalk abilities as though they didn't have those abilities.

cards.name: Thrive
cards.text: Put a +1/+1 counter on each of X target creatures.
cards.flavor: The most successful of Simic creations is cytoplasm, a living, symbiotic substance that feeds off genetic rhythms and strengthens its host in return.

rulings.text: It means X different creatures. You can't give more than one +1/+1 counter to a creature with this spell.

cards.originalText: Put a +1/+1 counter on each of X target creatures.

cards.name: Utopia Sprawl
cards.text:
Enchant Forest
As Utopia Sprawl enters the battlefield, choose a color.
Whenever enchanted Forest is tapped for mana, its controller adds an additional one mana of the chosen color.
cards.originalText:
Enchant Forest
As Utopia Sprawl comes into play, choose a color.
Whenever enchanted Forest is tapped for mana, its controller adds one mana of the chosen color to his or her mana pool.

cards.name: Verdant Eidolon
cards.text:
{G}, Sacrifice Verdant Eidolon: Add three mana of any one color.
Whenever you cast a multicolored spell, you may return Verdant Eidolon from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.originalText:
{G}, Sacrifice Verdant Eidolon: Add three mana of any one color to your mana pool.
Whenever you play a multicolored spell, you may return Verdant Eidolon from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Aethermage's Touch
cards.text: Reveal the top four cards of your library. You may put a creature card from among them onto the battlefield. It gains "At the beginning of your end step, return this creature to its owner's hand." Then put the rest of the cards revealed this way on the bottom of your library in any order.

rulings.text: If you don't reveal any creature cards, or if you choose not to put a revealed creature card onto the battlefield, all the revealed cards go on the bottom of your library.
If the creature that you put onto the battlefield leaves the battlefield before your next end step, it won't be returned to your hand at the beginning of your next end step.
If you put a creature onto the battlefield this way during your end step, it won't be returned to your hand until your next end step.
The triggered ability that the creature gains won't be copied if an effect creates a token that's a copy of that creature or causes another object to become a copy of that creature.

cards.originalText: Reveal the top four cards of your library. You may put a creature card from among them into play with "At the end of your turn, return this creature to its owner's hand." Then put the rest of the cards revealed this way on the bottom of your library in any order.

cards.name: Anthem of Rakdos
cards.text:
Whenever a creature you control attacks, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn and Anthem of Rakdos deals 1 damage to you.
Hellbent — As long as you have no cards in hand, if a source you control would deal damage to a permanent or player, it deals double that damage to that permanent or player instead.

rulings.text: The first ability triggers once for each creature you attack with. If you attack with three creatures, for example, they'll each get +2/+0 and you'll be dealt 3 damage.
The hellbent ability doubles the damage dealt to you by Anthem of Rakdos itself.

If damage that would be dealt to a player or creature is affected by both Anthem of Rakdos and a damage prevention effect, that player or that creature's controller chooses the order to apply the effects. In most cases that player will want to prevent damage, then double what's left.
If a source you control would deal damage to multiple creatures and/or players simultaneously, all of that damage is doubled.

cards.originalText:
Whenever a creature you control attacks, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn and Anthem of Rakdos deals 1 damage to you.
Hellbent As long as you have no cards in hand, if a source you control would deal damage to a creature or player, it deals double that damage to that creature or player instead.

cards.name: Assault Zeppelid
cards.text: Flying, trample
cards.flavor:
"Show them to Razia and then to the Azorius sky marshals. We could create a fine bidding war—enough to fund the final stages of Project Kraj."
—Momir Vig
cards.originalText: Flying, trample

cards.name: Azorius Aethermage
cards.text: Whenever a permanent is returned to your hand, you may pay {1}. If you do, draw a card.
cards.flavor: In her single metasphere are bound the records of every Ætheric transaction since the time of Azor.

rulings.text: This ability will trigger whenever any permanent, including a token creature or Azorius Aethermage itself, is returned to your hand. It doesn't matter who controlled the permanent or if it had ever actually been in your hand before.

foreignNames.name: アゾリウスの霊気魔道士

cards.originalText: Whenever a permanent is returned to your hand, you may pay {1}. If you do, draw a card.

cards.name: Azorius First-Wing
cards.text: Flying, protection from enchantments
cards.flavor: With a steady diet of lawbreakers, Azorius griffins inevitably develop a resistance to the contraband magic that taints much of their prey.

rulings.text: "Protection from enchantments" means that Azorius First-Wing can't be enchanted, it can't be targeted by Aura spells or by abilities of enchantments, all damage that would be dealt to it by enchantments is prevented, and it can't be blocked by creatures that are also enchantments.
If an effect tries to move an Aura onto this creature, the effect will fail and the Aura will stay where it was.
Azorius First-Wing doesn't have protection from creatures that are enchanted.

cards.originalText: Flying, protection from enchantments

cards.name: Azorius Ploy
cards.text:
Prevent all combat damage target creature would deal this turn.
Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn.
cards.flavor: Azorius military tactics, like their legal tactics, capitalize on delay and nullification.

rulings.text: The two targets may be the same creature or they may be different creatures.

cards.originalText:
Prevent all combat damage target creature would deal this turn.
Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn.

cards.name: Coiling Oracle
cards.text: When Coiling Oracle enters the battlefield, reveal the top card of your library. If it's a land card, put it onto the battlefield. Otherwise, put that card into your hand.
cards.flavor: Snaking remnants of nature directed by a body of thought and progress, the oracles embody all that is Simic.
cards.originalText: When Coiling Oracle comes into play, reveal the top card of your library. If it's a land card, put it into play. Otherwise, put that card into your hand.

cards.name: Cytoshape
cards.text: Choose a nonlegendary creature on the battlefield. Target creature becomes a copy of that creature until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Though highly effective at reshaping flesh, these specially bred cytoplasts leave the subject reeking of omnibian mucus."
—Simic research notes

rulings.text: Only the creature that's becoming a copy is targeted. The creature that it will copy isn't chosen until Cytoshape resolves.

The creature copies the printed values of the chosen creature, plus any copy effects that have been applied to it. It won't copy counters on that creature. It won't copy effects that have changed the creature's power, toughness, types, color, or so on.
If the creature copies a creature that's copying a creature, it will become whatever the chosen creature is copying.

If the creature becomes a copy of a face-down creature, it will become a 2/2 creature with no name, creature type, abilities, mana cost, or color. It will not become face-down and thus can't be turned face up.

This effect can cause the target to stop being a creature. For example, if it becomes a copy of an animated Blinkmoth Nexus, the printed wording will be copied and it will become an unanimated Blinkmoth Nexus.

Effects that have already applied to the target creature will continue to apply to it. For example, if Giant Growth had given it +3/+3 earlier in the turn, then Cytoshape makes it a copy of Grizzly Bears, it will be a 5/5 Grizzly Bears.
A creature may become a copy of itself this way. This generally won't have any visible effect.
At the end of the turn, the creature reverts to what it was before. If two Cytoshapes affect the same creature on the same turn, they'll both wear off at the same time.

cards.originalText: Choose a nonlegendary creature in play. Target creature becomes a copy of that creature until end of turn.

cards.name: Dread Slag
cards.text:
Trample
Dread Slag gets -4/-4 for each card in your hand.
cards.flavor: A thousand phobias sopped from the city and wrung from Rix Maadi as one.
cards.originalText:
Trample
Dread Slag gets -4/-4 for each card in your hand.

cards.name: Experiment Kraj
cards.text:
Experiment Kraj has all activated abilities of each other creature with a +1/+1 counter on it.
{T}: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
cards.flavor:
"Of course it will grow beyond control—it was designed to choose its own evolution."
—Momir Vig

rulings.text: Unlike with cards like Quicksilver Elemental, the costs of the activated abilities Experiment Kraj gains must be paid with the correct colors of mana.
Activated abilities contain a colon. They're generally written "[Cost]: [Effect]." Some keywords are activated abilities and will have colons in their reminder text.

cards.originalText:
Experiment Kraj has all activated abilities of each other creature with a +1/+1 counter on it.
{T}: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.

cards.name: Gobhobbler Rats
cards.text: Hellbent — As long as you have no cards in hand, Gobhobbler Rats gets +1/+0 and has "{B}: Regenerate Gobhobbler Rats."
cards.flavor: Lyzolda's pet rats eat better than the average citizen. In fact, they can usually be found eating the average citizen.
cards.originalText: Hellbent Gobhobbler Rats gets +1/+0 and has "{B}: Regenerate Gobhobbler Rats" as long as you have no cards in hand.

cards.name: Grand Arbiter Augustin IV
cards.text:
White spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
Blue spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
Spells your opponents cast cost {1} more to cast.
cards.flavor: The Arbiter is a conduit of justice, a will so disciplined that it dispenses justice without ego or remorse.

rulings.text: Spells you cast that are both blue and white cost {2} less to cast.
This reduces only generic mana portion of mana costs. A spell you cast with mana cost {1}{W}{U} will cost {W}{U} to cast.

foreignNames.name: 大仲裁者奥古斯汀四世
アウグスティン四世大判事

cards.originalText:
White spells you play cost {1} less to play.
Blue spells you play cost {1} less to play.
Spells your opponents play cost {1} more to play.

cards.name: Hellhole Rats
cards.text:
Haste
When Hellhole Rats enters the battlefield, target player discards a card. Hellhole Rats deals damage to that player equal to that card's converted mana cost.
cards.flavor:
"I must speak with Momir Vig about creating a water-spouting watchdog."
—Mathvan, Prahv scrollwarden
cards.originalText:
Haste
When Hellhole Rats comes into play, target player discards a card. Hellhole Rats deals damage to that player equal to that card's converted mana cost.

cards.name: Isperia the Inscrutable
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Isperia the Inscrutable deals combat damage to a player, choose a card name. That player reveals their hand. If a card with the chosen name is revealed this way, search your library for a creature card with flying, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: The card is named when the ability resolves. The named card can't be played after it's named but before the player's hand is revealed.

foreignNames.name: 不可解なるイスペリア

cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever Isperia the Inscrutable deals combat damage to a player, name a card. That player reveals his or her hand. If he or she reveals the named card, search your library for a creature card with flying, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Jagged Poppet
cards.text:
Whenever Jagged Poppet is dealt damage, discard that many cards.
Hellbent — Whenever Jagged Poppet deals combat damage to a player, if you have no cards in hand, that player discards cards equal to the damage.
cards.flavor: Few puppets are so willing.
cards.originalText:
Whenever Jagged Poppet is dealt damage, discard that many cards.
Hellbent Whenever Jagged Poppet deals combat damage to a player, if you have no cards in hand, that player discards cards equal to the damage.

cards.name: Leafdrake Roost
cards.text:
Enchant land
Enchanted land has "{G}{U}, {T}: Create a 2/2 green and blue Drake creature token with flying."
cards.flavor:
"The best experiments are those whose successes replicate themselves."
—Yolov, Simic bioengineer

foreignNames.name: 木の葉ドレイクの休息地

cards.originalText:
Enchant land
Enchanted land has "{G}{U}, {T}: Put a 2/2 green and blue Drake creature token with flying into play."

cards.name: Lyzolda, the Blood Witch
cards.text: {2}, Sacrifice a creature: Lyzolda, the Blood Witch deals 2 damage to any target if the sacrificed creature was red. Draw a card if the sacrificed creature was black.
cards.flavor: Sacrificial rites take place before an audience of cheering cultists, each begging to be the next on stage.

rulings.text: You can sacrifice any creature you control to pay for this ability. If the creature was neither red nor black, the ability has no effect.

You must choose a target for the ability, even if the creature you sacrifice isn't red. If the target becomes illegal before the ability resolves, the ability won't resolve; you won't draw a card, even if the creature you sacrificed was black.

cards.originalText: {2}, Sacrifice a creature: Lyzolda, the Blood Witch deals 2 damage to target creature or player if the sacrificed creature was red. Draw a card if the sacrificed creature was black.

cards.name: Momir Vig, Simic Visionary
cards.text:
Whenever you cast a green creature spell, you may search your library for a creature card and reveal it. If you do, shuffle your library and put that card on top of it.
Whenever you cast a blue creature spell, reveal the top card of your library. If it's a creature card, put that card into your hand.

rulings.text: If you cast a green and blue creature spell, both abilities will trigger. The abilities may be stacked so that when they resolve, you search your library for a creature card, put it on top of your library, and then put that card into your hand. The abilities may also be stacked in the other order, of course.

foreignNames.name: シミックの幻想家、モミール・ヴィグ

cards.originalText:
Whenever you play a green creature spell, you may search your library for a creature card and reveal it. If you do, shuffle your library and put that card on top of it.
Whenever you play a blue creature spell, reveal the top card of your library. If it's a creature card, put that card into your hand.

cards.name: Omnibian
cards.text: {T}: Target creature becomes a Frog with base power and toughness 3/3 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"This creature has hyperevolved chameleonic abilities. It no longer mimics its surroundings, instead forcing them to take on its form."
—Simic research notes

rulings.text: If the target creature has any counters on it that modify its power and toughness (such as a +1/+1 counter), those counters will continue to affect the creature after it becomes 3/3. In the example given, it will be 4/4.

If the target creature is affected by any effects that modify its power or toughness without setting them to specific values (such as from Giant Growth), Omnibian's effect will be applied before those effects. In the example given, the creature will be 6/6.
This effect changes only the power, toughness, and creature type of the targeted creature. It does not cause that creature to lose any abilities.

cards.originalText: {T}: Target creature becomes a 3/3 Frog until end of turn.

cards.name: Overrule
cards.text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {X}. You gain X life.
cards.flavor: With one commanding word, the spell was put down and a fine collected for its casting.

rulings.text: You gain the life whether or not the spell's controller pays {X} and whether or not the spell is countered.

cards.originalText: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {X}. You gain X life.

cards.name: Pain Magnification
cards.text: Whenever an opponent is dealt 3 or more damage by a single source, that player discards a card.
cards.flavor: The Rakdos make sure their victims remember their pain—or at least give up a little bit of their sanity in order to forget.

rulings.text: This triggers only if all 3 or more damage is dealt at the same time. It doesn't trigger if damage that adds up to 3 or more is dealt at different times by the same source.
If a source deals 3 or more damage to multiple opponents at the same time, this ability will trigger once for each of those opponents. They will each have to discard a card.

cards.originalText: Whenever an opponent is dealt 3 or more damage by a single source, that player discards a card.

cards.name: Palliation Accord
cards.text:
Whenever a creature an opponent controls becomes tapped, put a shield counter on Palliation Accord.
Remove a shield counter from Palliation Accord: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to you this turn.
cards.originalText:
Whenever a creature an opponent controls becomes tapped, put a shield counter on Palliation Accord.
Remove a shield counter from Palliation Accord: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to you this turn.

cards.name: Plaxcaster Frogling
cards.text:
Graft 3 (This creature enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it. Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, you may move a +1/+1 counter from this creature onto it.)
{2}: Target creature with a +1/+1 counter on it gains shroud until end of turn. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
cards.originalText:
Graft 3 (This creature comes into play with three +1/+1 counters on it. Whenever another creature comes into play, you may move a +1/+1 counter from this creature onto it.)
{2}: Target creature with a +1/+1 counter on it can't be the target of spells or abilities this turn.

cards.name: Plumes of Peace
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
Forecast — {W}{U}, Reveal Plumes of Peace from your hand: Tap target creature. (Activate this ability only during your upkeep and only once each turn.)
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
Forecast {W}{U}, Reveal Plumes of Peace from your hand: Tap target creature. (Play this ability only during your upkeep and only once each turn.)

cards.name: Pride of the Clouds
cards.text:
Flying
Pride of the Clouds gets +1/+1 for each other creature with flying on the battlefield.
Forecast — {2}{W}{U}, Reveal Pride of the Clouds from your hand: Create a 1/1 white and blue Bird creature token with flying. (Activate this ability only during your upkeep and only once each turn.)
cards.originalText:
Flying
Pride of the Clouds gets +1/+1 for each other creature in play with flying.
Forecast {2}{W}{U}, Reveal Pride of the Clouds from your hand: Put a 1/1 white and blue Bird creature token with flying into play. (Play this ability only during your upkeep and only once each turn.)

cards.name: Rain of Gore
cards.text: If a spell or ability would cause its controller to gain life, that player loses that much life instead.
cards.flavor:
"Stay indoors, away from what seeps over the thresholds. This is the Demon's work, and only ill can come of it."
—Belko, owner of Titan's Keg tavern

rulings.text: This does not apply to life gain caused by combat damage from a creature with lifelink.

cards.originalText: If a spell or ability would cause its controller to gain life, that player loses that much life instead.

cards.name: Rakdos Augermage
cards.text:
First strike
{T}: Reveal your hand and discard a card of target opponent's choice. Then that player reveals their hand and discards a card of your choice. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
cards.flavor: "Great minds bleed alike."

foreignNames.name: ラクドスの穴開け魔道士

cards.originalText:
First strike
{T}: Reveal your hand and discard a card of target opponent's choice. Then that player reveals his or her hand and discards a card of your choice. Play this ability only any time you could play a sorcery.

cards.name: Rakdos Ickspitter
cards.text: {T}: Rakdos Ickspitter deals 1 damage to target creature and that creature's controller loses 1 life.
cards.flavor:
"Our thrulls dissolve from the inside out in a matter of days. Shoddy work, but they're a scream while they last."
—Uzric, Rakdos guildmage
cards.originalText: {T}: Rakdos Ickspitter deals 1 damage to target creature and that creature's controller loses 1 life.

cards.name: Rakdos the Defiler
cards.text:
Flying, trample
Whenever Rakdos the Defiler attacks, sacrifice half the non-Demon permanents you control, rounded up.
Whenever Rakdos deals combat damage to a player, that player sacrifices half the non-Demon permanents they control, rounded up.

rulings.text: To calculate the number of permanents that must be sacrificed, count the number of permanents the affected player controls that don't have the subtype Demon, then divide that number in half and round up. For example, a player who controls eleven non-Demon permanents will need to sacrifice six of them.
A permanent with the subtype Demon, including Rakdos the Defiler itself, can't be sacrificed this way.

cards.originalText:
Flying, trample
Whenever Rakdos the Defiler attacks, sacrifice half the non-Demon permanents you control, rounded up.
Whenever Rakdos deals combat damage to a player, that player sacrifices half the non-Demon permanents he or she controls, rounded up.

cards.name: Simic Sky Swallower
cards.text:
Flying, trample
Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
cards.flavor:
"We've bred out the shortcomings of the species' natural form and replaced them with assets of our own design."
—Momir Vig
cards.originalText:
Flying, trample
Simic Sky Swallower can't be the target of spells or abilities.

cards.name: Sky Hussar
cards.text:
Flying
When Sky Hussar enters the battlefield, untap all creatures you control.
Forecast — Tap two untapped white and/or blue creatures you control, Reveal Sky Hussar from your hand: Draw a card. (Activate this ability only during your upkeep and only once each turn.)
cards.originalText:
Flying
When Sky Hussar comes into play, untap all creatures you control.
Forecast Tap two untapped white and/or blue creatures you control, Reveal Sky Hussar from your hand: Draw a card. (Play this ability only during your upkeep and only once each turn.)

cards.name: Swift Silence
cards.text: Counter all other spells. Draw a card for each spell countered this way.
cards.flavor:
"This world may not know peace, but in my presence you will know quiet."
—Augustin IV
cards.originalText: Counter all other spells. Draw a card for each spell countered this way.

cards.name: Trygon Predator
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Trygon Predator deals combat damage to a player, you may destroy target artifact or enchantment that player controls.
cards.flavor: Held aloft by metabolized magic, trygons are ravenous for sources of mystic fuel.
cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever Trygon Predator deals combat damage to a player, you may destroy target artifact or enchantment that player controls.

cards.name: Twinstrike
cards.text:
Twinstrike deals 2 damage to each of two target creatures.
Hellbent — Destroy those creatures instead if you have no cards in hand.
cards.flavor: They're dying left and right.
cards.originalText:
Twinstrike deals 2 damage to each of two target creatures.
Hellbent Destroy those creatures instead if you have no cards in hand.

cards.name: Vigean Hydropon
cards.text:
Graft 5 (This creature enters the battlefield with five +1/+1 counters on it. Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, you may move a +1/+1 counter from this creature onto it.)
Vigean Hydropon can't attack or block.
cards.flavor: Fruits of magic, roots in science.

rulings.text: Even though this creature can't attack, it doesn't have defender.

cards.originalText:
Graft 5 (This creature comes into play with five +1/+1 counters on it. Whenever another creature comes into play, you may move a +1/+1 counter from this creature onto it.)
Vigean Hydropon can't attack or block.

cards.name: Vigean Intuition
cards.text: Choose a card type, then reveal the top four cards of your library. Put all cards of the chosen type revealed this way into your hand and the rest into your graveyard. (Artifact, creature, enchantment, instant, land, planeswalker, sorcery, and tribal are card types.)
cards.originalText: Choose a card type, then reveal the top four cards of your library. Put all cards of the chosen type revealed this way into your hand and the rest into your graveyard. (The card types are artifact, creature, enchantment, instant, land, and sorcery.)

cards.name: Voidslime
cards.text: Counter target spell, activated ability, or triggered ability. (Mana abilities can't be targeted.)
cards.flavor:
"It is technically an ooze, but its lifespan measures only seconds. In that short time, its appetite for magic is extraordinary."
—Simic research notes

rulings.text: Activated abilities contain a colon. They're generally written "[Cost]: [Effect]." Some keywords are activated abilities and will have colons in their reminder text.

cards.originalText: Counter target spell, activated ability, or triggered ability. (Mana abilities can't be targeted.)

cards.name: Windreaver
cards.text:
Flying
{W}: Windreaver gains vigilance until end of turn.
{W}: Windreaver gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
{U}: Switch Windreaver's power and toughness until end of turn.
{U}: Return Windreaver to its owner's hand.

rulings.text: Effects that switch power and toughness apply after all other effects that change power and/or toughness, regardless of which effect was created first.
Switching a creature's power and toughness twice (or any even number of times) effectively returns the creature to the power and toughness it had before any switches.

cards.originalText:
Flying
{W}: Windreaver gains vigilance until end of turn.
{W}: Windreaver gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
{U}: Switch Windreaver's power and toughness until end of turn.
{U}: Return Windreaver to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Wrecking Ball
cards.text: Destroy target creature or land.
cards.flavor: Rakdos festivals almost leave enough rubble in their wake to hide the bodies.
cards.originalText: Destroy target creature or land.

cards.name: Avatar of Discord
cards.text:
({B/R} can be paid with either {B} or {R}.)
Flying
When Avatar of Discord enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you discard two cards.
cards.flavor: Such is the power of Rakdos that even his shadow takes on a cruel life of its own.
cards.originalText:
({B/R} can be paid with either {B} or {R}.)
Flying
When Avatar of Discord comes into play, sacrifice it unless you discard two cards.

cards.name: Azorius Guildmage
cards.text:
{2}{W}: Tap target creature.
{2}{U}: Counter target activated ability. (Mana abilities can't be targeted.)

rulings.text: Activated abilities contain a colon. They're generally written "[Cost]: [Effect]." Some keywords are activated abilities and will have colons in their reminder text.

foreignNames.name: アゾリウスのギルド魔道士

cards.originalText:
({W/U} can be paid with either {W} or {U}.)
{2}{W}: Tap target creature.
{2}{U}: Counter target activated ability. (Mana abilities can't be targeted.)

cards.name: Biomantic Mastery
cards.text: Draw a card for each creature target player controls, then draw a card for each creature another target player controls.
cards.flavor:
"Look beyond, to the vascular awareness that all life is a map to greater knowledge."
—Momir Vig, Biomancy, vol. I

rulings.text: You choose both targets before you draw any cards. The targets must be different. One of them may be you.

cards.originalText:
({G/U} can be paid with either {G} or {U}.)
Draw a card for each creature target player controls, then draw a card for each creature another target player controls.

cards.name: Dovescape
cards.text:
({W/U} can be paid with either {W} or {U}.)
Whenever a player casts a noncreature spell, counter that spell. That player creates X 1/1 white and blue Bird creature tokens with flying, where X is the spell's converted mana cost.

rulings.text: The Bird tokens are created even if the spell isn't countered by Dovescape's ability. This may happen because the spell can't be countered, because it's already been countered, or because it's otherwise been removed from the stack by the time Dovescape's ability resolves.
If a split card is cast, Dovescape makes tokens equal to the converted mana cost of the half that was cast.

cards.originalText:
({W/U} can be paid with either {W} or {U}.)
Whenever a player plays a noncreature spell, counter that spell. That player puts X 1/1 white and blue Bird creature tokens with flying into play, where X is the spell's converted mana cost.

cards.name: Minister of Impediments
cards.text:
({W/U} can be paid with either {W} or {U}.)
{T}: Tap target creature.
cards.flavor: When it takes forever to learn all the rules, no time is left for breaking them.
cards.originalText:
({W/U} can be paid with either {W} or {U}.)
{T}: Tap target creature.

cards.name: Rakdos Guildmage
cards.text:
({B/R} can be paid with either {B} or {R}.)
{3}{B}, Discard a card: Target creature gets -2/-2 until end of turn.
{3}{R}: Create a 2/1 red Goblin creature token with haste. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step.

rulings.text: If the second ability is activated during the End step, the token won't be exiled until the following turn's End step.

foreignNames.name: ラクドスのギルド魔道士

cards.originalText:
({B/R} can be paid with either {B} or {R}.)
{3}{B}, Discard a card: Target creature gets -2/-2 until end of turn.
{3}{R}: Put a 2/1 red Goblin creature token with haste into play. Remove it from the game at end of turn.

cards.name: Riot Spikes
cards.text:
({B/R} can be paid with either {B} or {R}.)
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/-1.
cards.flavor: Most auramancers would have let the spikes hover just above the skin. Having the spikes rip through the skin from beneath was a touch added by Rakdos himself.
cards.originalText:
({B/R} can be paid with either {B} or {R}.)
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/-1.

cards.name: Shielding Plax
cards.text:
({G/U} can be paid with either {G} or {U}.)
Enchant creature
When Shielding Plax enters the battlefield, draw a card.
Enchanted creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.

rulings.text: This is not the same as hexproof. If, for example, you target one of your opponent's creatures, your opponents won't be able to target their own creature with spells or abilities.

cards.originalText:
({G/U} can be paid with either {G} or {U}.)
Enchant creature
When Shielding Plax comes into play, draw a card.
Enchanted creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.

cards.name: Simic Guildmage
cards.text:
({G/U} can be paid with either {G} or {U}.)
{1}{G}: Move a +1/+1 counter from target creature onto another target creature with the same controller.
{1}{U}: Attach target Aura attached to a permanent to another permanent with the same controller.

rulings.text: For the first ability, the first target creature doesn't need to have a +1/+1 counter on it. If it doesn't, the ability does nothing.

For the first ability, if the two target creatures aren't controlled by the same player when the ability resolves, the ability does nothing. The player who controls the two creatures doesn't have to be the same player who controlled them when the ability was activated, and that player doesn't have to be Simic Guildmage's controller.

For the second ability, only the Aura is targeted. When the ability resolves, you choose a permanent to move the Aura onto. It can't be the permanent the Aura is already attached to, it must be controlled by the player who controls the permanent the Aura is attached to, and it must be able to be enchanted by the Aura. (It doesn't matter who controls the Aura or who controls Simic Guildmage.) If no such permanent exists, the Aura doesn't move.

foreignNames.name: シミックのギルド魔道士

cards.originalText:
({G/U} can be paid with either {G} or {U}.)
{1}{G}: Move a +1/+1 counter from target creature onto another target creature with the same controller.
{1}{U}: Attach target Aura enchanting a permanent to another permanent with the same controller.

cards.name: Bound
cards.text: Sacrifice a creature. Return up to X cards from your graveyard to your hand, where X is the number of colors that creature was. Exile this card.

rulings.text: The creature is sacrificed when Bound resolves. It's not an additional cost. It's not optional. If you can't sacrifice a creature or a colorless creature is sacrificed, no cards are returned.
The cards in the graveyard that you return as part of Bound's effect aren't targeted. They're chosen when the spell resolves. The creature you sacrificed may be one of them.

cards.originalText: Sacrifice a creature. Return up to X cards from your graveyard to your hand, where X is the number of colors that creature was. Then remove this card from the game.

cards.name: Determined
cards.text:
Other spells you control can't be countered this turn.
Draw a card.

rulings.text: After Determined resolves, any spells or abilities that would counter a spell you control that turn will still resolve. They just won't counter that spell.
Spells you control may be countered by spells or abilities while Determined is on the stack, waiting to resolve.

cards.originalText:
Other spells you control can't be countered by spells or abilities this turn.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Crime
cards.text: Put target creature or enchantment card from an opponent's graveyard onto the battlefield under your control.
cards.originalText: Put target creature or enchantment card in an opponent's graveyard into play under your control.

cards.name: Punishment
cards.text: Destroy each artifact, creature, and enchantment with converted mana cost X.
cards.originalText: Destroy each artifact, creature, and enchantment with converted mana cost X.
